---
title: "New indicators for theory-guided research developed"
date: 2024-02-26
---

A working group consisting of Nele Freyer, Jens Lange, Daniel Leising, Philipp Musfeld, and Felix Schönbrodt developed a set of indicators that allows to evaluate theory-guided research.

The indicators cover both narrative and formal theories, and they cover both theory development and theory testing.

In the general philosophy of RESQUE, these indicators mostly focus on "hygiene factors": Properties of theory-guided research that are necessary but not sufficient for high-quality research.

Here are the indicators:

<hr>

<div title=""><p id="P_Theory_Def" class="type-info P_Theory_Def"><h3>Theory usage and development</h3><br><br>In the following, the term '<i>theory</i>' is used for a set of (interconnected) ideas that explain empirical phenomena. Theories may be expressed in a narrative and/or a more formalized manner. The term '<i>model</i>' is reserved for a (part of a) theory that is expressed mathematically or algorithmically.</p></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing title">[P_Theorizing] Theory-guided research and theory development</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes'</code> ]</p><div class="radio alignment-vertical type-radio P_Theorizing" id="P_Theorizing"><label><input type="radio" value="DescriptiveExploratory" name="P_Theorizing" class="type-radio"><span>[DescriptiveExploratory] This research was mainly descriptive and/or exploratory, without clear reference to a theory</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="TheoryGuided" name="P_Theorizing" class="type-radio"><span>[TheoryGuided] In this research, at least one theory was (further) developed and/or evaluated</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="NotApplicable" name="P_Theorizing" class="type-radio"><span>[NotApplicable] Not applicable / cannot answer the question</span></label></div></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing_NAExplanation title">[P_Theorizing_NAExplanation] ⤷ Not Applicable: Explanation</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'NotApplicable'</code> ]</p><input type="text" placeholder="⤷ Not Applicable: Explanation" class="type-text P_Theorizing_NAExplanation" id="P_Theorizing_NAExplanation"></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing_Quality title">[P_Theorizing_Quality] The paper …</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'TheoryGuided'</code> ]</p><div class="type-checkbox P_Theorizing_Quality" id="P_Theorizing_Quality"><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Quality_NarrativeAccount" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Quality_NarrativeAccount] contains an <b>explicit narrative account</b> of the <i>phenomena</i> that are to be explained, and of one or more hypothetical <i>mechanisms</i> accounting for them (i.e., a theory).</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Quality_NarrativeDefinitions" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Quality_NarrativeDefinitions] contains <b>explicit narrative definitions of each element</b> (concepts, relationships, etc.) in the theory. All of this is made easily findable (e.g., under a standard heading 'Definitions').</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Quality_FormalizedAccount" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Quality_FormalizedAccount] contains a <b>formalized account of the theory (i.e., a model)</b> using a commonly accepted standard notation (e.g., mathematical or logical operations, ODD protocol for ABMs). This includes all connections among the elements of the theory, and a formalization of the phenomena that are to be explained.</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Quality_MathProps" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Quality_MathProps] contains a formalized account of the theory (i.e., a model) <b>and</b> explicates the basic <b>mathematical properties</b> of all elements of the model (e.g., scalar vs. matrix; dimensionality; units carrying the information).</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Quality_PossibleValues" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Quality_PossibleValues] contains a formalized account of the theory (i.e., a model) <b>and</b> explicates the <b>possible values for all elements</b> of the model (i.e., upper and lower bounds, scale level).</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Quality_ObjectiveDerivation" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Quality_ObjectiveDerivation] contains a formalized account of the theory (i.e., a model) <b>and</b> explicitly derives predictions from that. The <b>derivation is objective</b>, in the sense that any person would come to the exact same predictions.</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Quality_Falsifiability" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Quality_Falsifiability] contains a formalized account of the theory (i.e., a model) <b>and</b> all stated predictions are in principle <b>falsifiable</b> (before considering operationalizations).</span></label></div></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing_Type title">[P_Theorizing_Type] In what language or system is the theory formulated?</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'TheoryGuided'</code> ]</p><div class="radio alignment-vertical type-radio P_Theorizing_Type" id="P_Theorizing_Type"><label><input type="radio" value="Narrative" name="P_Theorizing_Type" class="type-radio"><span>[Narrative] Narrative</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="Mathematical" name="P_Theorizing_Type" class="type-radio"><span>[Mathematical] Mathematical</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="FormalLogic" name="P_Theorizing_Type" class="type-radio"><span>[FormalLogic] Formal-Logic</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="ABM" name="P_Theorizing_Type" class="type-radio"><span>[ABM] Agent-based model</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="Other" name="P_Theorizing_Type" class="type-radio"><span>[Other] Other (please specify)</span></label></div></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theory_Type_Other title">[P_Theory_Type_Other] Theory type/ Language: Other</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'TheoryGuided' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing_Type === 'Other'</code> ]</p><input type="text" placeholder="Theory type/ Language: Other" class="type-text P_Theory_Type_Other" id="P_Theory_Type_Other"></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing_Contribution title">[P_Theorizing_Contribution] How much did you personally contribute to this version of the theory?</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'TheoryGuided'</code> ]</p><div class="radio alignment-vertical type-radio P_Theorizing_Contribution" id="P_Theorizing_Contribution"><label><input type="radio" value="No" name="P_Theorizing_Contribution" class="type-radio"><span>[No] I did not contribute to this version of the theory itself (i.e., I did no theoretical work beyond testing a theory)</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="Yes" name="P_Theorizing_Contribution" class="type-radio"><span>[Yes] I did contribute significantly to this version of the theory</span></label></div></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing_ContributionType title">[P_Theorizing_ContributionType] I significantly contributed to ...</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'TheoryGuided' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing_Contribution === 'Yes'</code> ]</p><div class="type-checkbox P_Theorizing_ContributionType" id="P_Theorizing_ContributionType"><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_ContributionType_NarrativeDevelopment" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_ContributionType_NarrativeDevelopment] the overall development of an entire narrative theory</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_ContributionType_NarrativeRefinement" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_ContributionType_NarrativeRefinement] the expansion or refinement of an existing narrative theory</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_ContributionType_FormalizationFirst" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_ContributionType_FormalizationFirst] the first formalization of an existing narrative theory</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_ContributionType_FormalizationStandAlone" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_ContributionType_FormalizationStandAlone] the overall development of an entire formal model of which there was no narrative version</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_ContributionType_FormalizationRefinement" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_ContributionType_FormalizationRefinement] the expansion or refinement of an existing formal model</span></label></div></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing_Test title">[P_Theorizing_Test] Did you <b>test</b> (a part of) this theory?</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'TheoryGuided'</code> ]</p><div class="radio alignment-vertical type-radio P_Theorizing_Test" id="P_Theorizing_Test"><label><input type="radio" value="No" name="P_Theorizing_Test" class="type-radio"><span>[No] No</span></label><label><input type="radio" value="Yes" name="P_Theorizing_Test" class="type-radio"><span>[Yes] Yes</span></label></div></div><div title=""><hr><p class="P_Theorizing_Test_Quality title">[P_Theorizing_Test_Quality] The paper …</p><p style="color: gray; font-size: 0.8rem;">[ <i>Condition:</i>  <code>\$P_Suitable === 'Yes' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing === 'TheoryGuided' &amp;&amp; \$P_Theorizing_Test === 'Yes'</code> ]</p><div class="type-checkbox P_Theorizing_Test_Quality" id="P_Theorizing_Test_Quality"><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Assumptions" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Assumptions] describes all necessary assumptions that were necessary to make the theory testable (including ad-hoc assumptions).</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Operationalization" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Operationalization] describes which, how, and why elements of the theory are measured, estimated, or fixed to specific values.</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Derivation" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Derivation] makes clear how the tested hypotheses logically and stringently follow from the theory.</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Evaluation" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Evaluation] evaluates the relative and/or absolute model fit with appropriate procedures (e.g., out-of-sample cross-validation, AIC, BIC, LOO, Bayes Factors).</span></label><label><input type="checkbox" id="P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Discussion" class="type-checkbox" data-min-selected="undefined"><span>[P_Theorizing_Test_Quality_Discussion] contains an explicit discussion as to what the results mean for the theory that was tested.</span></label></div></div>
